website_summaries.verdict: Behind this simple word game is a cunning head-to-head competition that works with nearly any number of players. Great for a crowd.
pros: Whether you enjoy word games or not, the simplicity of Codenames will appeal to just about anyone
Gameplay is fast and intense, and the variety of word cards mean you can play over and over
cons: The language-based nature of the game can make it difficult to play for young children or those with vision problems

website_summaries.verdict: A simple yet clever word game for two teams that is quick and rewarding.
pros: Codenames pits 2 teams of 2 to 5 players against each other in a contest of words and clever clues
Players give clues to their teammates to get them to guess the correct word
Each turn is suspenseful, and with 200 cards, no 2 games are alike
Each game takes 15 minutes, so it's easy to play several rounds in an evening
cons: Though the rules are simple, giving clues may be difficult for some people as there is a lot to think about

website_summaries.verdict: A team-based word game that is always intense.
pros: You don’t need a prodigious vocabulary to play this simple word game
Comes with 200 double-sided word cards for infinite replayability, and can be played with 2 or more players
Works well for parties and big groups
cons: Younger players may have trouble coming up with clues

customer_reviews.title: Hard game to play unless you don’t mind a lot of downtime.
customer_reviews.text: We are gamers, I own almost 100 games. I was excited to try this game due to the high rating. It was an epic fail. First you have to try to give clues that are only for your group of cards and none of the other teams. You give a one word clue that is suppose to relate to one or more cards (only you know which ones) and your partner better have the same thought train. The guessers complained we took too long between giving clues UNTIL the next game when they became the clue givers and saw it wasn’t easy. This is not a fun light hearted game and I doubt young children could play at all.
customer_reviews.author: Page

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected unboxing surprise
customer_reviews.text: I finally bought my own after playing and loving this game at friends' places. As I excitedly unboxed the game, I was showered with a gust of white dust like a fairy farting glitter all over me. It turns out not to be a fairy but the sand from the broken hourglass timer. I am not going to bother returning this game because, effort and my friends and I are often a few drinks deep when we play this game to care about time. Still love the game. Three star for unexpected fairy glitter fart.
customer_reviews.author: Anh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very fun. Even the little ones can play and I ...
customer_reviews.text: My family wasn't too sure about this game when I showed it to them but they quickly changed their mind. Soon they were recruiting players in from other rooms! The last thing said at Thanksgiving is that everyone is playing on Christmas! Very fun. Even the little ones can play and I believe they would learn some good thinking skills while they do. And with all the options, I can't imagine you'd ever play the same game twice.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: My friends and I didn’t enjoy this game. Giving clues is so easy and so is guessing them. Your turn ends when your timer ends or your team guesses wrong. My team guessed all the words to “win” before the sand timer was even done, not giving the second team a chance. When we started a new game with the other team, THEY won everything without my team having a chance due to how easy the words were. We followed the rules, gave clues for the words and finished a round in 5 minutes. Really boring and I don’t recommend. I’m not sure why it has so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ante

customer_reviews.title: Bastards... they're all bastards...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to play this game for a while and so I bought it for myself when it went on sale. It sat on the kitchen counter for weeks because no one wanted to play, I like playing games a lot more than the rest of my family apparently. Well I had to run out and do some errands for a couple hours one night. Upon my return home I walked in on the family packing this game back up. They played it while I was gone and said it was a lot of fun. FML...
customer_reviews.author: MyItchyChin

customer_reviews.title: Best Party/Group Game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game because you work together as a team against the other team to solve the clues of who your "spies" are and trying not to guess the other teams spies, innocent bystanders or the assassin. Good for laughs and collaboration. Note- my friends are on the smarter side. I played one time with people who were younger and less educated and it didn't go as well...
customer_reviews.author: annlovesdogs

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game because everyone raved about what a great party game it was. And I've broken it out at a few parties and... its all right? Every time we played had the same issue. You set up the cards, and then you have to wait 10 minutes while your two leads try to figure out what all their cards are. And then there's about 5 minutes of gameplay. And then you take another 10 minute break while everyone waits on the new leads to figure things out. It's just slow and everyone gets bored fast.
customer_reviews.author: 3J

customer_reviews.title: I AM ADDICTED
customer_reviews.text: My son and daughter-in-law brought this game on a long weekend trip together and I loved it. It is a game that makes you think but you have fun at the same time. It helps to know your partner well but if you can give great one word clues then no problem. It is fast paced and not one of those games where anyone feels left out or stupid. Pay attention and listen to the clues is my advice!! I bought one game and then decided I needed another for our beach place so we can play no matter where we are located. It is small and light so easy to add to your luggage.
customer_reviews.author: shopinful

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I played this game only once and I knew I needed one for myself. I bought it and it was always been a great success in reunions with friends. It is very easy to learn and suitable for all ages. This is something you can play with your family or friends, I think it would even be useful as "team building" at work. Its also good for non native English speakers to learn new vocabulary.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea GT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, fun and engaging
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of those rare few board games that we can still play while physically distancing at respective homes. A friend recommended it after playing it at an online board game social event at work. The game was fun, not hard to learn at all, and you can be competitive if you want to but since each round goes quickly it doesn’t drive you crazy. Each round takes only about 15-20min, mainly depending on how long the spymasters take to come up with a word to guess, and we played it without the timer. Would definitely be bringing this game along when we can have social gatherings again!
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: I think we're  addicted!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our family LOVES this game!! Easy to learn, it doesn't drag on for hours; challenging but it doesn't take a 'rocket scientist' to play it. My son-in-law IS a rocket scientist (Haha, for real) but the rest of us...truckers, retired store manager, server, etc. won as often as he did! Loads of laughter, and a great time, was had by all!! Try it!! You'll LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our new favorite game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. It is our new favorite. It gives you an opportunity to exercise your brain and have fun at the same time. The only complaint we have is that the cards have the words written in big font one way and small font the other way. When we play with older family members with glasses, there's always someone who can't see the word. It would have been nice if they made both directions (for the spymaster and the team) the same large font.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 4+ people
customer_reviews.text: I love this game and I've given it as a gift to several people, including families with kids as young as 8. I've actually never met anyone who doesn't like it -- and most of us love it. The grid of 5x5 words constantly changes, giving you new words to try to connect. It works for parties of more than 4 because you just divide into 1 relatively equal teams. The words the designers chose to include are perfect because most have more than one meaning, giving you lots of options. It's a great gift, a fun time and I just don't know how it couldn't be a hit. Totally buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: It's fun enough but just an average game
customer_reviews.text: It's fun enough but just an average game, not a five star. I see such strong acclaim for it, but I'm not sure why. There are much more fun word games like Say Anything, or strategic games like the resistance or coup.
customer_reviews.author: xian

customer_reviews.title: Family Fav!
customer_reviews.text: It should be noted that you'll need at least 4 people to play (2 teams, each with 2 or more members). 6+ is ideal. We last played with a group of seven (including two friends who don't have English as a native language). Everybody loved this game! It's a bit tricky to kick off the first time if no one knows how to play. I recommend having one person learn all the rules in advance, so they can quickly bring everyone up-to-speed when the group assembles. Once you've got it, this game is genius in it's simplicity, lively, and intellectually challenging. Be sure to throw the other team off with false flags.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: so fun!
customer_reviews.text: this is one of my favorites for game night! my friends have always been the ones to bring it, but I saw this for such a great price ($10) and I couldn't resist! now I'm introducing it to my family, friends, and anyone that will listen! easy to play and catch on to, probably easier if you first play with someone who has played before. we played with my younger sister who is 12, and it was a little tricky for her to come up with clues, but she did fine with guessing! again, love this game!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Call

customer_reviews.title: Fun party game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a family Christmas get together and we all enjoyed it. It is kind of hard to explain verbally, but if you play the Youtube video of a person explaining the rules and how to play it makes it much easier. I always tell people "it is like battleship but with words" and that seems to make it click for most people. It is a fun, no stress game to play at a party.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: 5 star for the product 3 star for the game
customer_reviews.text: 5-star product The product is great quality. The agent cards, key-cards, timer etc are all great in build. The box was appropriate for the content and Amazon had on-time delivery with good packaging. 3-star game The game is not for audience less than 4. And for larger group I thought the game was more serious than fun. Though it's an okay game, for a party game this was more intense and serious. For party games I'd recommend games like Coup (with resistence expansion), mascarade, ultimate werewolf etc. Also, everyone may not have that good vocab so it might be a challenge to play this game with a diverse audience.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: This is our new favorite family game!
customer_reviews.text: Great new family game! We took this along with another new game on a holiday trip, and this was the one everyone wanted to play over and over. From the grandparents to the grandkids (ages 10 and up), we all loved it. What's fascinating is how the board lines up differently every time and really challenges the players to use very specific vocabulary to make their point. Depending on the players, you can use more sophisticated words to try to score more, but the younger players can still be engaged as well! We look forward to getting new decks so we can keep playing this for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: BVES

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Watch out. This has “party supplies” attached to product but is no different from other Amazon listing for $10 less.
customer_reviews.author: Dame Chat

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Game For All Types of People
customer_reviews.text: This might be the best game I have played since Cards Against Humanity. This is a great game for people that know each other, or a great icebreaker for those who don't. You can be as literal or as creative as you'd like with your descriptions and unlike other games with cards - the possibilities of card layouts are nearly infinite (or possibly infinite - no math required) so you don't have to toss it just because you play it often. At least three other people have bought this game after playing it with us. If you enjoy "thinking outside the box" this is definitely a game for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine R.

customer_reviews.title: Great slow-paced group game
customer_reviews.text: We are always looking for good group games, and this one is great because you can have a variable amount of people and can play with a pretty good-sized crowd. Also, for people who are not into strategy board games, this is a crowd-pleaser. It is very easy to explain to people and to jump right in and play. Also, because you shuffle the deck, you can play endlessly and not run out of variety (like with Taboo). It is also is great for promoting teamwork and creativity, and gives opportunity for lots of laughs as you try to comprehend how another's brain works.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: Our son and daughter in law had purchased this game and so had we, but neither of us knew about the other. They played with another couple and we hadn't played yet. They wanted to introduce us to a new game they said, and we told them we wanted to do the same. Same game! Alot of fun as you begin to learn how the mind of the card master opposite you thinks. Would like to play with more than just four people to see what fun it could be. Not always easy either. Makes you really think!
customer_reviews.author: Sneekypete

customer_reviews.title: Very fun but repetitive after some time
customer_reviews.text: This is a very straightforward and easy-to-learn game. You can enjoy playing it in your gatherings of any size. The combination of the words in the game is pretty amusing. The inly problem with this game is that after a couple of times playing it, yiu start remembering the words and its associated keyword. For example, when we were first playing it, I suggestsed machine learning for amazon, and from then, everybody knows what machine learning is referring to: amazon! My suggestion to producer of this game is that they can separately sell packs of new words, and the buyers, including me, will buy it. All in all, it’s a very fun game but loses it’s quality over time.
customer_reviews.author: arsalan90

customer_reviews.title: Replayable fun for four or more word lovers. Great game!
customer_reviews.text: This game merits all the great reviews. The premise is simple: one person on your team gives one-word clues to try to get their teammates to guess the team's secret words while helping them avoid the other team's words -- or worse, the "insta-death" word. Think you can get your teammates to guess "Jupiter" and "moon" without guessing "Saturn"? It's harder than you think because there are almost always multiple sets of words like that. And if you can figure out how to connect hotel, plot and turkey, you might be great at this game. It's super fun trying to work out what your teammates know and might guess. A truly great party game for word lovers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Really fun with the right group of people
customer_reviews.text: This game is really fun with the right group of people. You need people in teams that kind of think alike or are in the same age group. I am 24 and tried playing with my grandma and it’s not as fun because she thinks completely differently than me. It would work if she was teamed with my grandpa and I was teamed with my brother though. I guess that’s part of the game. I love playing this with people my own age though.
customer_reviews.author: Greg tucker

customer_reviews.title: Good strategy game
customer_reviews.text: Game is simple to understand. Two teams, two roles, 1 provides clues, 1 guesses the word. Played with two boys 10 and 7 and husband, they picked up the games immediately and had a ball playing. Will recommend. Good for ages 6 and up, based on my experience with my kids. My only feedback would be to provide more game cards and possibly an extension pack of cards for a difficult level of words. Still a great game as is, but another pack of cards wouldn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Working mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Fun with four people
customer_reviews.text: I have played this game before in a larger group and it just didn't work. It did not make sense and no one got it right away. Now having played this again with only four people total I definitely think its more of a couple vs couple game. I played this over Christmas with My husband and brother and sis in law, it was way more fun than I remembered. I would say its a great game for a certain number of people and people that enjoy word type, guessing/thinking games.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Love This Game!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this game and the challenges it presents. The goal is to give a one-word clue that directs your team to pick up certain cards by making word connections. The problem is sometimes a word for your team can have a connection that leads to picking a card for the opponent's team. The instructions are easy and didn't take long to learn or explain to others who've never played. Set up is very easy. When playing in teams, hearing people's thinking is a lot of fun. But I also enjoyed the 3 play game. I liked this game so much that I also purchased the adult version.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a while, could be less expensive
customer_reviews.text: Great game, fun to play with family and easy to learn. It does get boring after a playing a few times because the game isn’t very dynamic. You set it up, and try to get your partner/team to guess the words; that’s about it. It’s also time consuming and somewhat tedious to set up. Each round you have to manually line up 25 cards to play. I wish there was an easier/faster way to do that. Given that the game has a basic concept and set up is player intensive, it could definitely have a lower price point. Especially since we haven’t played it in a while and aren’t getting much use because of those aspects.
customer_reviews.author: HonestyIsKey

customer_reviews.title: BOX FILLED WITH WHITE POWDER
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! I purchased this as a Christmas gift and the recipients just called to let me know that the box was full of a white powdery substance. Even the unopened plastic holding the packs of cards had the powder inside of them. I didn’t feel good about having them return the product to Amazon— it needed to just get out of their home ASAP. So now we have to replace it, but we won’t be buying it from Amazon again. This has the potential to be an extremely dangerous situation and I am so disappointed in Amazon for not having better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Rbecca23

customer_reviews.title: A very enjoyable pastime
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game...it crosses age groups easily (I've played with family and friends aged 12 to 60+ years) and we've always had a fine time. The instructions are a little difficult to read...I think they were translated into English...so I found a review online that also explained how the game was played and that was helpful. Once you get the hang of it, this is a fun game, lots of laughter and opportunities to become dramatic spy-hunters!
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: Codenames is by far one of the family favorites. It's an easy game to learn and it's a lot of fun with a lot of people. It's hard to find games where 10 people can play at once, but this one you definitely can. Really you could play with as many people as you wanted if you're up for a challenge because of all the different minds coming together, but I would recommend this game to anyone who is wanting a new game for themselves or for the family.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Hales

customer_reviews.title: Party game
customer_reviews.text: Great party game. Good across many ages and especially good if people need to wander away a bit. The team can keep going. Pro tip for the lazy: you can photograph the words with your smart phone then mark the words off in edit mode as the game plays. Then everyone except the code masters can sit comfortably anywhere they can hear the game. I've played many games with many groups and this one is nice and light and scales well. It's always well received. Intergenerational teams prove an advantage as different connections are made between the words.
customer_reviews.author: Delayed Gratification

customer_reviews.title: So much fun, love this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun! My family plays it had gatherings and parties. I love it! It is super easy to pick up and learn. The hardest part is being the spy master and coming up with hints that your team will understand. You can play with more people than the box says. I’d go up to 12. Just have 5 people guessing an 1 spymaster on each team. It works out. This game is really fun. I had 9 friends over and we played this game for 3 hours it is so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Game was broken!
customer_reviews.text: Really frustrated that the timer was broken when the game arrived, and there was sand everywhere. I got this for a gift and brought it all the way to Finland, and when we opened it, my friends asked if I was a drug dealer because of all the white powder. The game is actually fine, but I'm frustrated that I wasn't able to give my friends an intact gift.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey G

customer_reviews.title: Fun thinking game
customer_reviews.text: While I would classify this as a thinking game, it doesn't require any special knowledge. Just some basic reasoning and associative skills. One thing that's nice about the game is that even though it is based on a set of word cards, there is little advantage to having seen or used a card before because of the way that the game works. I have always played with 4 or more players but the box says 2 to 8+. The average time for a round is roughly 20 minutes. You could speed that up by using a timer if you like. Overall I would say that it is a fun game for family or couples that you won't tired of quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite game!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn, great for adult board game parties. Could probably play with teens and older children too. This is the one game that I can enjoy both with my friends (med students in their 20s) and family (and can include grandma with Alzheimer disease, etc.). Rounds go fairly quickly, and there's however much strategy you want to have. There are also times when you can visit with other team members, while the other side is thinking about their next move.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fun, 4 players and up
customer_reviews.text: Even though there's a bunch of 5-star reviews about this game, I was still al little skeptical since the idea and description wasn't that sexy or exciting. However, after having played it with friends from 4 people to 8 people, I totally agree that this is a very good group game. With endless variety, ease of rules, and high amount of interaction between players (but not nearly as argument and hurt-feeling inducing as Settlers of Catan), I highly recommend this game for 4 people and up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Love this game!
customer_reviews.text: Codenames is my absolute favorite game. It gets everyone engaged with each other, and stretches your brain in ways you didn't know possible. The drawbacks are some people don't have the discipline to remain quiet and keep a straight face, which is required by the spymaster. This results in the team having an unfair advantage, and therefore consternation during the game. If everyone plays by the rules this game is mind blowing fun!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Cape

customer_reviews.title: Fun game with a good challenge
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about buying this because I saw a few reviews mentioning that the board game looked used and/or there was broken pieces in the packaging. But mine came in perfection condition! I got this as a gift and the recipient was very happy with it. It's a fun game which makes you think deductively. I enjoy this part especially because it's a little bit of a brain workout when you play compared to some games that are mostly luck. You will learn to associate the most unrelated words as well. If you are looking for a little bit of a challenge in a game and you enjoy word play then this is really a good price.
customer_reviews.author: ChocoCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Loved playing this game with our family
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very enjoyable game for our family to play. It really makes you think! Game play is also fast enough to allow everyone to switch roles and teams if you want. We recommend this to any family or group of friends looking to try a novel and interesting game for game night. :) There is also a short instructional video you can stream that gives a quick overview of game play and the main rules. Brilliant! It allowed us to all get up to speed faster and jump right into the game.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T

customer_reviews.title: Fun game - especially with close friends or family
customer_reviews.text: The key of the game is to know your audience - In-jokes, references, anything you can use to make them remember something that no one else knows about. So, the game is decently fun for strangers to play, but it's SUPER fun for close friends or family. The quality of the cards is great, the rules are explained well, and it has a very high replay value due to each person's individual word associations.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Graham

customer_reviews.title: educational game! interactive and kids friendly
customer_reviews.text: It is very interesting and interactive game. Adults can play for while before they get bored. For Kids, this is very educational, and it induces critical thinking. The quality of the game is very nice. the color card has a stand that comes with this game. which will help keep the color card direction in stable. if there was not for stand, the game can be super confusing. this game also comes with the Small sand timer, which is helpful if you want to limit the time for thinking. all the cards and parts of the games are made well with good quality, some are not water friendly. but this version of the game is nice and standard quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my son, daughter-in-law and their 2 kids, ages 12 and 9. They reported back that they had fun with this, and that the kids understood the directions and did fine with them. The parents had to make sure they understood some of the vocabulary. I played with a big gang somewhere else, and had a great time. The younger kids teamed up with adults, and really enjoyed it!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Way too simple
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this game gets high reviews. I think the creators want you to try to provide a one word clue for more than one code name. But you have no incentive for doing that. All you have to do is provide one good clue for one code name and your turn continues. We played two games, whoever started ran the table. It wasn't fun and seems a waste of time. Unless I missed something in the rules this was not fun. Perhaps for very small children.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great group game.
customer_reviews.text: One issue we have with our friend group is finding games that can be played with more than 5 players. This game is always a huge hit! You play with two teams, but the more people on a team, the more fun I think...so it's a great game for larger groups. We have so much fun, and have yet to get bored with it (there are so many different cards each game is different). You can play with all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and quick game
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun and quick to learn. Warning though, the instructions make me feel overwhelmed. But once you start playing POOF it is easy and fast to learn. Played it with my family this last weekend and we ended up playing for HOURS because everyone was having so much fun trying to be all sneaky and smart. Also you should buy the two player version also. Worth the extra money. That way you and your loved one can have some extra co-op practice and WIN when groups come over.
customer_reviews.author: adaley4

customer_reviews.title: Good family game
customer_reviews.text: This game is exactly what I was looking for, our 8 year old daughter and 11 year old son had a great time with us, and they even asked to play it again the day after our first time playing. For younger kids I'd suggest skipping some of the harder codenames like Himalayas or embassy, but it's easy to do. This would be fun to try with all adults too, and it's a quick game (15 mins) so you're not stuck playing for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pernecky

customer_reviews.title: One of the best games around.
customer_reviews.text: One of the greatest games out there right now. Team game. I’ve played it in a group as large as 42 (although we wrote the words out much larger for everyone to see). Changes every time. In this game you have a code master giving clues to his team trying to have them guess specific words on the grid without having them guess other words. It can be very challenging as once you start thinking about it you can link any two words together! Great to see into the minds of other people. 20 minutes game play. Youngest child I’ve played with was 6, but essentially they need to be able to read.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Brownlow

customer_reviews.title: Not really for 2 people - minimum suggested is 4
customer_reviews.text: The description that this is for 2-8 people is really misleading. With 2 people the rules are changed and in effect you are playing cooperatively. It's not nearly the same game as with 4, the suggested minimum. No good for me and my daughter, but you cannot know that without reading the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: I love this game
customer_reviews.text: It is really easy to play and best of all, is really easy to play with large groups. It can get loud as everyone starts to yell out their theories to each other and it is definitely a competitive game, but it is really fun. I recommend it for anyone trying to have something to play with large groups, or that needs a game for all ages. I think this could easily be played with kids.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: Very fun once you get the hang of the rules. It's pretty simple but my family had a hard time getting started with everything as some of the instructions are a little vague or just suggestions on how you can play. My family likes hard set rules. My advice is basically just jump in once you have a basic understanding. The rules don't have to be hard set as long as your family doesn't get too competitive during game time ...like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 or 4 players
customer_reviews.text: The first time I played this game was on a first date, which was a blast! The premise of the game is to use one single word per turn to steer your partner toward choosing particular tiles, while avoiding others. I like to think I'm a creative person with solid critical thinking skills, but each turn was a challenge, in a good way. The rules are very simple--it only took a few short minutes to understand the game. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brian S

customer_reviews.title: Such a great game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is great! I got it for Christmas and accidentally left it at my mom's. We decided she could keep it and we would just buy another one. The packaging was just as good as the one bought at Target and had all the same parts. We love this game and even my husband, who hates playing games with my "NFL level" game playing family, likes to play with us.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Betthauser

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome!! I played with 6 people which felt like a good number. Super easy to play, just make sure you read the instructions thoroughly. If you don’t read the directions you won’t know what’s going on. I’d also recommend a few trial rounds to understand what’s happening. This game is strategic and makes you think, but also lots of fun! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Hackmann

customer_reviews.title: fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is super fun the first couple of times you play but once the concept is figured out it gets boring because one team goes first and they usual finish and win before the other team gets a chance to play. It is a good game to use your brain and imagination and I think it's good for younger kids (8-12). It's not so fun for adults because we can come up with better clues that ends the game quicker. I wish the game came with more words and more complicated words.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! We have played with adults only, with kids only, and with a mix of adults and kids. All combinations have provided a different and fun experience. Easy to learn, easy to play, challenging not to lose. We have found that 12 yrs old and up plays best, while 8 yrs old is probably the cut off. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Family of 11

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-Generational Family Game
customer_reviews.text: My family loves games. We bought this game for Thanksgiving. Three generations played together and thoroughly enjoyed. It really makes you think to come up with connections that will encourage your partner to choose the right words from the array. It's a really great game for people who like words and who like to 'think outside the box' when finding clever connections between words. It's definitely going into our rotation.
customer_reviews.author: NC Mom

customer_reviews.title: Super-fun team-play game
customer_reviews.text: This is a clever logic / strategy game, and one that can play fairly PG if that's what you're after. Gameplay's easy to follow and the very large number of cards ensures great replay value. I'm docking a point, though, for build quality; opened the box and got sand EVERYWHERE (including, alas, my keyboard) thanks to the poorly assembled timer. Unwrap with caution -- and after that, have fun!
customer_reviews.author: A. Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 4 people!  Can't play with less and more works poorly.
customer_reviews.text: A very fun and challenging word game for 4 people. The backstory about spies actually has little to do with the game itself. It is a word guessing game which is very cleverly formulated and enjoyable to play. Must have a minimum of 4 people to play. Can play with teams if there are more than four but the extra people have little to do.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada City CA

customer_reviews.title: Nice Game
customer_reviews.text: Great game for game night. I am happy to have my own copy finally. Watch the seller though - the game was sealed, but the sand timer was broken and the sand was everywhere/ Also a bunch of empty bags were in the box - not sure what is missing yet. There is no list of expected parts and no mention of why the bags are in there either.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: I love games that make you think and that are great team games. Codenames is both. You have to figure out how to give one word clues to your team mates that will help them guess the correct word or words without helping the other team or getting your team assassinated. Problem solving, creativity, making associations, teamwork, communication, lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: sky rose

customer_reviews.title: Great game for family and friends looking to do word association.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure about this game as it sounds too easy or boring. But I decided to get it since it's award winning. Turns out it is a great game. I think teams of 2 or 3 is fun, not sure I would go over that. It's a word association game that you can get really creative with, so if your partner is on the same wavelength as you, you can kick the other team's butt. Quick paced as well so you can get a number of rounds out of it which is good if you want teams to switch off.
customer_reviews.author: jared harris

customer_reviews.title: Great party game!
customer_reviews.text: We have played this game with varying groups of people for game night and it's always fun. It's got just enough mental challenge to be exciting but it's easy to pick up. It also requires teamwork and talking, and makes you try to get in the codemaster's head to understand their clues. It's also very flexible - you can play just a few rounds or play for a long time and you can sub people in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Stapayr8485

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Party Game...possibly the best
customer_reviews.text: We (6 of us, 3 couples) played this a number of times over our vacation in Puerto Rico, and everybody loved it. I'm not really going to add anything new, as there are plenty of reviews, but I wanted to chalk up another 5 star rating. So much tension, whether you're the Spymaster or the teamguessers...it's really unbelievable. There's definitely a reason why this won not only the Spiel 2016, but also BGG Party Game of the year. Am so glad people recommended this to me on BGG for top 6-player game; made our trip that much more memorable! If you're in doubt, get this game and try it out for yourself. For a mere $15, you can't really lose.
customer_reviews.author: Ragamuffin JojoTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Great word association game!
customer_reviews.text: This game gets you thinking about how you can link words together and do it faster than the other team. With only one-word clues, it helps you become more thoughtful with your words. There are almost endless combinations too so you'll never play the same game twice. For those of you who hate games that are left to chance, this is a good game for you because it relies on brainpower. The only downside is you need at least four people to play, so it's great for groups but not for two people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Although says for 2+ players, it's really at its best with 4+
customer_reviews.text: Great game. Had played previously with someone else that owned it and thought it would be good for a family gathering of six people. Went over well with a group ranging in age from 12 to 73. They picked it up after one round and the 12 and 18 yr olds that didn't want to play initially were having a good time. Requires some thinking and strategy. Clean and teen friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all settings
customer_reviews.text: I first started playing this game with my other 20something friends in breweries or at house parties. I'd also play more tame versions with my roommates at home. It's so fun with friends! However, what I LOVE about this game is that it is family-friendly without being boring. I got this as a gift for my sister, and we had a ball playing with my parents, other sister, and brother-in-law. It's a challenging, adult-friendly game without any of the cringiness that comes from hearing your dad read cards during What Do You Meme (although I love that game too).
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replayability and Fun to Play and Watch!
customer_reviews.text: This game is easy to learn and has great replayability. One of the hardest things to learn is that, when you're spymaster, you really have to keep your poker face on. I personally find the challenge fun, and it's so amusing to watch the guessers' trains of thought. It's great for parties and getting to know other people, and I think it's even better with friends that you already know because you can test your friend-telepathy! My favorite thing about it is, despite reusing the limited number of cards, it is incredibly replayable because the map and card locations are always changing.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Pineapple

customer_reviews.title: Top Party Game on the Market
customer_reviews.text: In Codenames, players form two teams. Each team elects a Spymaster, and then the two Spymasters give clues to point the rest of their team to (code)words on the board. The catch is that the clues can only contain a single word and a single number. The word indicates which of the (code)words the players should pick, and the number indicates how many codewords match that particular clue. If you need a party game that can play 8-12 people comfortably, with each round taking about 10-15 minutes, this is a fantastic pickup. Less fun in small groups... I wouldn't play it with less than 6, and it is really best with 8-10.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher D.

customer_reviews.title: Great game for family get togethers
customer_reviews.text: Rules are relatively simple, very flexible about the number of people who can play (always two teams). Some relatives on one side of the family brought this out to play. Had so much fun, we bought it and took it to family get together with other side of the family, and they liked it too.
customer_reviews.author: Mainsil

customer_reviews.title: This Is a Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: This game has proven to be a lot of fun. My son and his girlfriend bought it, and we've been playing with them. When our other kids were here for a visit, we played with three to a team. Very enjoyable and even more fun when you switch partners. It's entertaining to see how everyone's minds work and the connections they make.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for 3 or more
customer_reviews.text: We've played this game several times now with different sized groups. As long as you have at least thee people and everyone can see the playing area it works well. The real strategy comes between the two spymasters who are giving the clues, but it's fun for everyone to participate. An easy game to learn as a participant. Definitely a keeper at our family get-togethers.
customer_reviews.author: Winkie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing! We have been playing with the kids (one 12 and other 10 years old) and they absolutely love this game! They find it interesting, and it makes them think fast and be “sneaky”. The adults find it equally awesome, and I’m glad I got it! You’ll learn the rules in 2 minutes, and it will be easy to set up and play.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Fun, fun fun. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We love this came. You can play two people or more. If more than two you play teams. It's more fun to play four or more people. We played this game during the holidays. It was addictive! We played every night non stop for hours. Great price for an awesome fun game. Easy and challenging. Just love it. We are game people. I have lots of games. This one is in my top five favorites. Highly recommend.!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: game broken
customer_reviews.text: My one star refers to the condition of the game, not the game itself. The game's timer was broken, so there was sand everywhere. One of the cards was also missing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great game!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids and I LOVE this game!! They are 13 and 16 and it's a great challenge. We modified the rules a bit because sometimes you just can't think of a clue that will encompass several of the words, so if you're only going after one word, you don't get an extra turn. Since the deck can be shuffled so the words you're trying to guess change with each game, it'll be a wonderful game for a long time to come!!
customer_reviews.author: VinniesMom

customer_reviews.title: STRATEGIC but NOT LONG!
customer_reviews.text: my favorite game for a few years now! this is great for almost all ages-- meaning a big group can include the younger kids... they might not be as good at it but you work as a team so it's ok. you can play one round or 10, depending how much time you want to put it. unlimited patterns to work from so while you can be good from experience you can't win because you "know all the cards". pretty easy to explain to newbies... as long as they aren't overserved or begrudgingly playing a game.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Ways Newman

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun Game; But Luck Can Be HUGE
customer_reviews.text: First off: fantastic word-association game. Splendid. Played it with two teams of 4 and it was a blast watching the field operatives discuss their guesses while the spymaster slowly died inside while trying to keep a straight face. One con: the random nature of the word grouping determined by the "grid" card can give one team a heavy advantage. One team can get several easy multi-word groupings, while the other team is left with a bunch of unrelated single-word turns and are reduced to blind guessing to stay in the game.
customer_reviews.author: Sean G

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 4 people, or 6 people - also works the brain!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game for all ages but works best for 10-12 and up if playing with adults and children mixed....Adults playing adults is super fun, a GREAT game for couples too.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Best group game there is
customer_reviews.text: Yooooooo if you're ready to play the best group/party game there is out there, then this is definitely a winner. I introduced this game to a bunch of my college friends and then they ended up buying a set for themselves because of how amazing it was. Codenames is a relatively simple game, but I will admit it takes some amount of patience. If you're ok with that, then give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Amil

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game!!! I have an entire big box of games for game night, but every time, this ends up being the crowd favorite. People say they hate games, then walk past and get sucked in, soon the whole table has people all the way around it playing along! Highly highly recommend! Fantastic game!
customer_reviews.author: milkywaystyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for serious GAMERS!!
customer_reviews.text: OK...my friends and I are HUUUUUUGE gamers and always looking for new games to play and this one is AMAZING!!!! We replay games over and over so it is important they have diversity and this game is IMPOSSIBLE to have the same outcome twice. All the cards are double sided and there are a lot of them so the word combos are endless. Also, all the answer key cards would change the game if they were turned 90 degrees. Add this game to your collection!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great game for nervous people
customer_reviews.text: Codenames is a word association game that is easy to understand right out of the box. Having simple rules doesn't mean this game isn't challenging. Players connect words and ideas in a way that their teammates can relate so this game doesn't require an Ivy League level vocabulary in order to do well but a little empathy and shared experience helps a lot. Codenames is a great party game for 4 or more players; there are instructions for 3 or fewer players but it doesn't really work out well.
customer_reviews.author: M Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Codenames Almost Kidnapped Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most fun game our family has found in quite a while! We played it on Christmas Eve before opening presents, and I had a hard time getting everyone to stop playing long enough to get to the presents. That has never happened before. They kept begging for just one more game. They were loud and raucous, totally involved. We have also played with only a few people, and this game is still fun. It takes a while to get used to which words on the table are whose, and you sometimes find yourself giving clues to the other team's words -- but that's just part of the fun. Highly, highly recommend Codenames!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Its a great game to throw into the mix
customer_reviews.text: It almost feel redundant to leave a review for this since everyone and their mother has done so already, but my gaming group loves Codenames. We tend to play more involved euro strategy games, but we decided to test Codenames after seeing so many positive reviews. Its a great game to throw into the mix, and usually gets us talking and joking around a bit more than our other games. It is easy to teach and set up, which is nice when we have newcomers to our gaming group. It would be great for kids, families, and adults. All around, a great game to add to your collection.
customer_reviews.author: DivaChalice

customer_reviews.title: Really fun and easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: I spent an hour playing this game with two nineteen year olds and we all agreed that it is a great game. Even with three persons (one being the guesser, two being the clue-givers), we had a blast. Best comment, "This is more fun than Secret Hitler." Easy to learn and a nice strategy game that involves words and word associations. I put it right up there (probably above) Exploding Kittens.
customer_reviews.author: JuLee Rudolf

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, challenging, and very simple rules.  One of the best casual games out there.
customer_reviews.text: It sounds like it wouldn't be that fun, but it is one of our favorites. You have to form a strategy based not only on logic, but in how you think your partner will interpret your words. While the other side has their turn, you can study the board so you come up with the perfect hint. There is also a balance between risk and reward. The game goes rather quickly, so people don't become fidgety. The rules are *very* simple, so there isn't much time spent reading them and explaining. All in all, one of the best casual games out there.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stokes

customer_reviews.title: So fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. We played at Xmas and I had to get a copy for myself. It's fun and you have to think to get this game done. I enjoy playing! Sometimes I can get one word to clear at least half the words and then others I just can't seem to get anything to match and go together. So fun. Glad I finally tried it. I want to get a Disney version now for the kids
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Fun strategic game. Makes you and your friends think.
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun. You can play it with just two people or a much larger group. There's a great amount of strategy and every game is different. It's easy to learn the rules and teach others for a fun party game night. The game itself is a little expensive, but you'll get your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Love this game because it is simple but it also reflects your abilities and vocabulary.
customer_reviews.text: It starts off slow as it will take a few tries to understand the concept (which is really easy once you play it so stick with it) but once you do, it really challenges you to be as clever as possible. It also gives you a clue as to how other people think and make word connections. The endless combination is great and not much to it other than setting it up. I and my friends love playing games. I like Taboo, Catch Phrase, Life (yes it is kid friendly), Acquire, Ticket to Ride, Picture Picture, Inkling, Guestures, Scattagories, and others. I wish I would have thought of this simple game!
customer_reviews.author: Feed my mind

customer_reviews.title: Currently my FAVORITE board game
customer_reviews.text: At the moment I like this board game more than Catan, Games Against Humanity, One Night Werewolf, Mysterium, Smash Up, Monopoly Deal, Tokkaido, Battlestar Galactica, Saboteur. So so so fun. My favorite moment so far is when two of my team's words were Greek and Unicorn, while one of the enemy team's words was Loch Ness Monster. I gave the clue Centaur, 2 and my team guessed both Greek and Unicorn. It was the most satisfying feeling I've had in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Liao

customer_reviews.title: High replayability makes this game a must buy
customer_reviews.text: Great game that involves and engages everyone so that no one is left out. Replayability is great so you can go several turns without it getting repetitive or old unlike other games. Also it is not overly long in generally; we really did even bother with the timer since the game flows pretty quickly. Reasoning skills and strategy are required so it is less based on luck. It is also balanced as to winning so that a veteran team would not always beat a new team. Overall excellent game, one of my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: n t

customer_reviews.title: Awesome For A Game night
customer_reviews.text: Super fun Family game. We have played with groups of 6 and 8. I think it’s best played with between 6-10 people. We had a lot of fun at a family game night. The game was easy to learn. We also played at Thanksgiving. Participants were between 15 and 60 years old. Everyone enjoyed it!
customer_reviews.author: Chrisk

customer_reviews.title: One of he funnest games out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these games I have bought! After my family played it, and loved it we bought it as a gift for another family. It makes you really think, but it is not too complicated for kids over 9 or so. I have recommended it to many people. The price is outstanding for games these days. I was delighted to find it for so inexpensive. You will not be sorry you ordered this. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Tera N.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game, especially when you try to come up ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, especially when you try to come up with one clue for multiple tiles....when it makes sense! My partner said, "Frozen..2". One of his words (which I didn't guess, of course), was "ghost". Really? Frozen ghost? Hmmm...LOL. Or...."baseball....2". On the board were mound, field, sport....nope. None of those....one was "stick" and I forget the other. New partner, please! :-) I was guilty as well, though. I said, "automobile...3" thinking I was clever. The cards were car, oil, and gas. I failed to notice, though, that other cards said trip, battery, and something else. This mistake gave the other team points. Oh well! We played with 4 people, but look forward to playing with 6!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S.

customer_reviews.title: A new addition to our go-to list of party games
customer_reviews.text: Very simple game, but excellent fun to play. As others have noted, the secret agent theme is fun, but it's really a great team word guessing game. The mechanic of trying to find the right clue to get your team to guess as many correct answers as possible while avoiding wrong answers is unique, and a great angle to the game. We've quite enjoyed playing this game many times over, and it holds up well with large numbers of people.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hollasch

customer_reviews.title: super clever game by a great developer
customer_reviews.text: super clever game by a great developer. what makes Codenames so wonderful is that every game is unique depending on who you're playing with. you can tailor your clues to your teammates and, when the round is over, setup is pretty much just rotating the little map card. it's a creative game that I've had a lot of enjoyment playing.
customer_reviews.author: niko

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad game necessarily but it seems way too easy to just run the table and win. We found that whoever goes first typically wins because it's too easy to guess the words and people rarely miss a guess.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

product_meta.title: Czech Games Codenames
product_meta.description: This is the Codenames Party Game.265 Cards Rule Book Card Stand Timer.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars9,950 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
